P088009.project_name: Brazil - Ecosystem Restoration of Riparian Forests in Sao Paulo

keywords.cdata: access to information, agricultural intensification, agricultural production, Agriculture, aquatic ecosystems, aquatic organisms, basins, Biodiversity, biodiversity conservation, Biological Diversity, capacity building, carbon, carbon dioxide, channel, Clean Development Mechanism, Climate, Climate Change, Conservation, conservation activities, Convention to Combat Desertification, Cost Analysis, crop production, crop rotation, cultivation, degraded forests, degraded lands, drainage, ecological balance, Economic analysis, economic incentives, ECOSYSTEM, ECOSYSTEM RESTORATION, ecosystems, environmental issues, Environmental Management, Environmental policies, Environmental Protection, erosion, erosion control, Exchange Rate, externalities, farmers, Farming, farming communities, farms, fertilizers, fish, fishing, floodplains, Forest, Forest Code, forest cover, Forest Ecosystems, Forest Monitoring, Forest Protection, forest rehabilitation, forest resources, Forest Restoration, Forestry, forestry sector, FORESTS, fruits, gauging, headwater areas, income, integrated pest management, labor costs, Land administration, Land degradation, land degradation processes, Land Management, land productivity, legislation, National Forest Program, National Forests, native species, natural resource, natural resource management, Natural Resources, Natural Resources Protection, organic matter, particles, pastoral lands, pasture, planting, Policy makers, poverty alleviation, preservation, producers,

project_abstract.cdata: The development objective of the Ecosystem Restoration of Riparian Forests in Sao Paulo Project is to support long-term, and large-scale restoration of the riparian forests at Cerrado, and the Atlantic Forest biomes, through the development and harmonization of policy, regulatory, economic, and technological tools and mechanisms, while providing opportunities for improved livelihoods, and economic well-being of rural communities. The project components focus on: 1) Policy Development - to establish a realistic framework for future implementation of a statewide program for the sustainable restoration of riparian forests; 2) support to sustainable riparian forest restoration - to increase the supply of seeds, and seedlings of native trees in support of riparian forests restoration in Sao Paulo; 3) on-the-ground investments in sustainable land management (SLM) practices - to promote, and disseminate methodologies, and technologies for SLM; 4) environmental education and training - to lay the foundation for effective participation of local populations in the planning, and implementation of local/regional development, and conservation activities; and, 5) project management, monitoring and evaluation, and information dissemination - to support the coordination and management of project activities.
